intro: Seddera bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate seddera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowering period usually occurs during the rainy season, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
